metadata.title: CVE-2018-12123 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0:Hostname spoofing in URL parser for javascript protocol: If a Node.jsapplication is using url.parse() to determine the URL hostname, thathostname can be spoofed by using a mixed case "javascript:" (e.g."javAscript:") protocol (other protocols are not affected). If securitydecisions are made about the URL based on the hostname, they may beincorrect.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12123` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 8.10.0~dfsg-2ubuntu0.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nodejs package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.10.0~dfsg-2ubuntu0.4+esm1').
